original_title: Sri Lanka CFA awards to highlight resilient portfolios
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s CFA Society said it will focus on strategies on how investors can build resilient portfolios as the country the emerges from a currency crisis and default.
The event is held in line with its 10th annual CFA Capital Market Awards scheduled to take place on June 21, 2023, under the theme ‘Invest Smart, Build Resilience, Thrive in Sri Lanka.’

“The event will capture the cautious optimism felt in the market and discuss the ways in which investors can build resilient portfolios in a Sri Lankan context, using both traditional and non-traditional investment options,” the CFA said in a statement.

A panel discussion will also be held to address topics such as temporary and long-lasting economic risks, investment portfolio management in the current context, risk mitigation, new avenues of investment including start-ups, and success stories from other markets and countries.

Deshal De Mel, an Economic Adviser to the Ministry of Finance, Naveen Gunawardane, the Co-founder and Chief Investment Officer of LYNEAR Wealth Management, and Anarkali Moonesinghe, a member of the Investment Committee of Angel Fund initiated by the Lankan Angel Network, will join the discussions.
The panel discussion will be moderated by Trisha Peries, the Head of Research at CAL Securities. (Colombo/June 18/ 2023)
